pageContext.title: Transforming The Afro-Caribbean World
pageContext.description_excerpt: The University of Maryland's Center for the History of the New America (CHNA) has partnered with MITH to develop the Transforming the Afro-Caribbean World (TAW) project to bring together scholars of the Panama Canal, Afro-Caribbean history, and experts in the digital humanities, data modeling, and visualization for a two-day planning workshop that will discuss a large-scale effort to explore Afro-Caribbean labor, migration, and the Panama Canal.
pageContext.participants: Jennifer Guiliano, Kirsten Keister, Trevor Mu√±oz, Julie Greene
